sn22.9:1.2: “Mendicants, form of the past and future is impermanent,
sn22.9:1.4: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about past form,
sn22.9:1.5: doesn’t look forward to enjoying future form,
sn22.9:1.6: and they practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding present form.
sn22.9:1.14: Consciousness of the past and future is impermanent,
sn22.9:1.16: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about past consciousness,
sn22.9:1.17: doesn’t look forward to enjoying future consciousness,
sn22.9:1.18: and they practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding present consciousness.”
